_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Frozen Cakes, Pies, and Other Pastries Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Foxtail Foods is committed to producing high quality food products in a safe and reliable manner through a number of ways, including the implementation of an employee safety program, implementation of a Process Safety Management program for the anhydrous ammonia system, and coordination with Butler County Local Emergency Planning Committee.



Foxtail Foods produces frozen pies, syrup and pancake mix.  Raw materials consisting primarily of various food ingredients are stored on-site in various forms such as dry storage warehouse, silo, and refrigerators/freezers.  Operations include pie crust mixers, pie filling lines, ovens for baking pie crust, kettles for mixing and cooking pie fillings, refrigerated storage and flash freezers, and shipping and receiving operations.  Pancake operations involve a flour silo, dry mixing operations, and packaging.  Finally, syrup operations involve kettles for cooking syrup and a small bottle filling line.  



The facility has ancillary operations that include utilities, cooling towers, and refrigeration systems.  The facility operates an anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system that contains approximately 13,000 lbs of anhydrous ammonia, which is a regulated substance under the EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) and under OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) program.  No other regulated substances are on-site in amounts that would trigger RMP and/or PSM requirements.



Foxtail Foods is subject to a number of rules and regulations regarding the anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system.  Foxtail complies with the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act (EPCRA) through submittal of emergency planning information and annual chemical inventories to the State of Ohio, Butler County and the local fire department.  In addition, the facility has a Process Safety Management (PSM) program and Hazard Communication program required under OSHA to ensure worker safety, a Risk Management Program (RMP) to ensure the safety of the surrou

nding community.  Finally, the facility is regulated by and complying with the Department of Homeland Security regulations regarding the ammonia system.



The facility has a number of devices and procedures surrounding the ammonia system to ensure its safe operation, including alarms, purge systems, sprinkler systems and process area monitors, along with procedures to respond to any malfunction that may occur.  In addition, the vast majority of the ammonia system is located inside the facility, thus further mitigating any potential release of ammonia.



The facility has an excellent history of operating the ammonia system, with no accidental releases within the last 5 years. 



The facility has an Emergency Response Program in place that includes coordination with Butler County LEPC and the local fire department.  The program includes frequent employee training and drills, as well as public notification procedures.



Foxtail Foods continues to evaluate and improve the ammonia system to ensure safety to its employees as well as to the surrounding community through frequent program reviews, outside audits, and operator training and drills.
